parametrized_description: A patient must consume oranges and grapefruits to satisfy minimum vitamin requirements. Each orange provides VitaminCPerOrange units of vitamin C and VitaminAPerOrange units of vitamin A, contributing SugarPerOrange grams of sugar. Each grapefruit provides VitaminCPerGrapefruit units of vitamin C and VitaminAPerGrapefruit units of vitamin A, contributing SugarPerGrapefruit grams of sugar. The patient must obtain at least MinVitaminC units of vitamin C and at least MinVitaminA units of vitamin A. Additionally, the number of oranges consumed must be at least MinOrangeToGrapefruitRatio times the number of grapefruits. The objective is to minimize the total sugar intake.

VitaminCPerOrange.description: Units of vitamin C per orange

VitaminAPerOrange.description: Units of vitamin A per orange

VitaminCPerGrapefruit.description: Units of vitamin C per grapefruit

VitaminAPerGrapefruit.description: Units of vitamin A per grapefruit

MinVitaminC.description: Minimum required units of vitamin C

MinVitaminA.description: Minimum required units of vitamin A

MinOrangeToGrapefruitRatio.description: Minimum ratio of oranges to grapefruits indicating preference

NumberOfOranges.description: The number of oranges the patient consumes

NumberOfGrapefruits.description: The number of grapefruits the patient consumes

constraints.description: The patient must obtain at least MinVitaminC units of vitamin C.
The patient must obtain at least MinVitaminA units of vitamin A.
The number of oranges consumed must be at least MinOrangeToGrapefruitRatio times the number of grapefruits.

objective.description: Total sugar intake is calculated as SugarPerOrange times the number of oranges plus SugarPerGrapefruit times the number of grapefruits. The objective is to minimize the total sugar intake.
